blog.name: wolfstarrtrash
blog.title: Wolfstar
blog.description: Anything and everything to do with our two favourite boys

summary: A few accounts to follow if you’re new to the fandom
body:
A few accounts to follow if you’re new to the fandom

@wolfstarwarehouse: without a doubt the best place to go if you’re looking for fic recs etc. make sure to check out their index and tag page if you’re looking for a fic with something specific in there. Their ask box is currently closed, but when it’s open you can ask for fic recs or get them to help you find a fic.

@wolfstarhq: Also a fic writer on ao3, wolfstarhq’s blog is a real mix. As well as posting their own original content, they also are a good place to find other creators content. Plus you also get to interact with them if that’s your thing, and they’re just all round good person.

@captofthesswolfstar: As well as posting and reblogging great content, she is also a sort of mum to the fandom, and you will often see her blog filled up with asks for advice (as her advice is amazing). But don’t let that fool you, she’s also an amazing fic writer and I would definitely recommend checking out We Were Infinite on ao3.

@jencala: Another fic writer, who’s fics feature heavily in my all time favourites, her account is a hub for all the quality wolfstar content. She, along with the others mentioned really liven up my dash and make scrolling through tumblr such a get experience.

Obviously there are heaps more amazing accounts out there, but these were some of the first four I followed and I would highly recommend checking all of them out.

blog.description: A bunch of texts, facebook posts and whatsapp messages keep getting screenshotted and put online for the world to see.

summary: Is my barty boy ok wth why didn't you just ask antonin to move the beds
question: Is my barty boy ok wth why didn't you just ask antonin to move the beds
answer:
Barty: I’m okay…. my head just hurts a little bit.  But whatever.  It’s fine.

Barty: I wanted to surprise him!  But he moved the beds together now, so tonight will be our first night with our beds together!  Last night I ended up in the hospital wing, so… yeah.

blog.name: eramidsummer
blog.title: (Nerdy)ramblings
blog.description:
Era | she/her | Polish | staying curious | ADHD | Catholic | vaguely literary, slightly angry, very popculturish, usually roaming without clear goal | regional gothic enthusiast | Snicketverse, TDP, TUA, neurodivergent stuff, B99, DGHDA, Gravity Falls, HP, thinking and intuition, popculture and culture | introvert | sideblog @visual-findings-disclosure |

fangirl | feel free to reblog my original posts & feel free to send me asks even if ur just bored and wanna talk | Instagram: kumpelsto

summary: Looking for blogs to follow Hello, fellow Tumblrers!  I want to follow more blogs and if you meet the conditions listed by me...
body:
Looking for blogs to follow

Hello, fellow Tumblrers! 

I want to follow more blogs and if you meet the conditions listed by me below, feel free to comment/like and I will follow you if I like your blog. I can’t promise anything, but I will give you a chance :) 

I am looking for blogs about topics listed below, where at least about two out of three posts are original (NOT REBLOGS). I don’t care if your original posts are long elaborate essays about some kind of fan theories or just so-called ‘shitposts’ where you rant about how excited you are for the new comic con or new Marvel movie(bc this kind of posts is my favorite). I care if YOU wrote them. 

Oh, and I’m not interested in gifs or photo edits from movies and TV shows, even if you made them. 

Topics I’m interested in: 

  • Dirk Gently’s Holistic Detective Agency (both BBCA TV show and the books)
  • Harry Potter - books & movies
  • A Series Of Unfortunate Events (books and the Netflix series) and Snicketverse in general
  • Gravity Falls (TV show)
  • Shipwrecked Comedy - Edgar Allan Poe’s Mystery Murder Dinner Party and The Case Of The Gilded Lily 
  • The Lord Of The Rings (both books and movies) & J.R.R. Tolkien works and his life
  • Marvel Cinematic Universe 
  • shower thoughts - blogs like @just-shower-thoughts
  • Sherlock Holmes (BBC show and original books mostly)
  • Matter Of Britain, Arthurian legends) 
  • art in general
  • Pride And Prejudice (booooook)
  • tea
  • cryptids and conspiracy theories (i don’t believe them but some of them are fun) *disclaimer* I don’t believe that Earth is flat - I’m sorry, Flatearthers
  • literature, art history, fun facts about history (especially Great Britain & USA) 
  • drawing, sketching, artsy stuff - especially if you create OCs
  • Oxford (mostly town itself, not only university) 
  • your original writing, stories, comics - fantasy and YA especially
  • linguistics
  • YA book reviews
  • cinematography, movie stuff, movie making, movie reviews 
  • creative stuff (interpret this as you want)choosing your career (idk really if this is a topic, but…)
  • if u don’t really blog about those things listed above, but you think your blog kinda fits into the pattern of these topics - comment, i will check ur blog out
  • aesthetics 
  • mbti &personality tests
  • character&story building

Thank you!

summary:
So I think after the war Ginny and Luna took Harry to SPA-center 
Since Harry grew up with Dursley of all people i bet our poor...
body:
So I think after the war Ginny and Luna took Harry to SPA-center

Since Harry grew up with Dursley of all people i bet our poor boy knows little to nothing about such things so he freaks out at the beginning

But then Ginny and Luna (who are together already at this point) persuade him and he obviously gives up (because really what chance Harry has against this two young ladies?)

So they spend a whole day in SPA doing absolutely nothing but enjoying themselves. They all get massage and Harry gets his nails manicured (because I’m absolutely sure he bits nails and they’re a mess), his hair cut nicely his skin cleaned and properly hydrated and so on and so on

At first he is hesitant but after they emerge from here he feels like he’s never been cleaner and more relaxed in his life

And then Luna gets him flower crown and they drink champagne and hug a lot (cause they all need a good hug) and they’re all happy

summary: ¡Y se acabó!  Llega el final de la historia de Harry Potter contada en imágenes (porque los lectores ya hace tiempo que sabíamos...
caption:
¡Y se acabó!

Llega el final de la historia de Harry Potter contada en imágenes (porque los lectores ya hace tiempo que sabíamos como acababa, ¡Leed malditos!)

No sé si contaros la historia o qué. Porque contaros toda la historia sería una pereza escribiendo, y si eso, siempre podéis leer este post de Vanetruzca, donde nos lo cuenta de una forma diferente.

Y tampoco quiero contaros la peli porque serían spoilers y me mataríais.

Entonces no puedo contaros como me decepcionó muchísimo al final porque estaba esperando que dijeran la otra parte de la profecía, eso que le daba un poco más de vidilla y protagonismo a uno de mis personajes favoritos, que, por otra parte, sale mucho en esta peli. Y es que claro, los espectadores se han perdido una parte importante de la historia al no saber que el protagonista podría haber sido otro.

En líneas generales la peli ha estado muy bien. Sí, no hace falta que diga, como todo el mundo ha dicho antes que yo, que esta película es muy oscura y bla bla bla. Tened en cuenta que los protagonistas (y el público objetivo) han ido creciendo con la historia. Llevar a tu niño de 5 años a ver esta peli porque Harry Potter es de niños no es correcto. Esta película es de adultos. Adultos que han crecido con Harry Potter y que empujan a niños para entrar primeros a la sala.

Lo que todos os preguntáis: Sí, sí que muere gente. Pero olvidaos de que se recreen en muertes importantes porque es una película para toda la familia (supuestamente) y la sangre no va a salpicar la pantalla. Por esta razón os digo que estéis muy atentos a las imágenes, porque igual hasta se os pasan por alto.

Ah, por cierto, que sepáis que sale Cedric Diggory, pero en el tráiler de Crepúsculo.

Pero olvidaos de que se recreen en muertes importantes porque es una película para toda la familia (supuestamente) y la sangre no va a salpicar la pantalla. Por esta razón os digo que estéis muy atentos a las imágenes, porque igual hasta se os pasan por alto.

Ah, por cierto, que sepáis que sale Cedric Diggory, pero en el tráiler de Crepúsculo.

trail.content_raw:
¡Y se acabó!

Llega el final de la historia de Harry Potter contada en imágenes (porque los lectores ya hace tiempo que sabíamos como acababa, ¡Leed malditos!)

No sé si contaros la historia o qué. Porque contaros toda la historia sería una pereza escribiendo, y si eso, siempre podéis leer este post de Vanetruzca, donde nos lo cuenta de una forma diferente.

Y tampoco quiero contaros la peli porque serían spoilers y me mataríais.

Entonces no puedo contaros como me decepcionó muchísimo al final porque estaba esperando que dijeran la otra parte de la profecía, eso que le daba un poco más de vidilla y protagonismo a uno de mis personajes favoritos, que, por otra parte, sale mucho en esta peli. Y es que claro, los espectadores se han perdido una parte importante de la historia al no saber que el protagonista podría haber sido otro.

[[MORE]]

En líneas generales la peli ha estado muy bien. Sí, no hace falta que diga, como todo el mundo ha dicho antes que yo, que esta película es muy oscura y bla bla bla. Tened en cuenta que los protagonistas (y el público objetivo) han ido creciendo con la historia. Llevar a tu niño de 5 años a ver esta peli porque Harry Potter es de niños no es correcto. Esta película es de adultos. Adultos que han crecido con Harry Potter y que empujan a niños para entrar primeros a la sala.

Lo que todos os preguntáis: Sí, sí que muere gente. Pero olvidaos de que se recreen en muertes importantes porque es una película para toda la familia (supuestamente) y la sangre no va a salpicar la pantalla. Por esta razón os digo que estéis muy atentos a las imágenes, porque igual hasta se os pasan por alto.

Ah, por cierto, que sepáis que sale Cedric Diggory, pero en el tráiler de Crepúsculo.

summary: The Netflix ASOUE series is the kind of adaptation I want of the Harry Potter books.
body:
The Netflix ASOUE series is the kind of adaptation I want of the Harry Potter books.


Literal monologues from the book,

Amazing actors,

Where there’s 2 episodes per book for ASOUE

There could be a season per book for HP,

Beautiful sets,

I dig it.


Thanks for coming to my TEDtalk. Bye.

summary: E01 - Harry Potter: Una generación de lectores ¡En nuestra primera aventura nuestra party se adentra en el mundo de Harry...
caption:
E01 - Harry Potter: Una generación de lectores

¡En nuestra primera aventura nuestra party se adentra en el mundo de Harry Potter! Únete a nosotros para hablar de nuestras experiencias con esta saga y su impacto sobre la cultura popular, además de analizar algunos de sus aspectos más curiosos.

blog.name: bitingdownpromo
blog.title: Biting Down
blog.description: The year is 2027. The wizarding community is tearing itself apart as danger lurks around every corner; the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power. Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance?

summary:
the electronics of your heart...
 The year is 2027. Nearly three decades have passed since the battle at Hogwarts and the...
caption:
the electronics of your heart…

The year is 2027. Nearly three decades have passed since the battle at Hogwarts and the wizarding world continues its uphill climb towards a slow, tumultuous recovery. Danger lurks around every corner as the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the wizarding community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power.

see how fast they fall apart…

Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance? Whether you flee or bite down and take the heat, the next great war is coming and the outcome is up to you. Welcome to Biting Down.

home | plot | rules | wanted connections | character suggestions | application

summary: A half-formed theory...
title: A half-formed theory...
body:
Has anyone else noticed the similarities between the One Ring and the three Deathly Hallows?

The simplest comparison is to the Cloak, since the One Ring also has the power to make the wearer invisible.

But there are similarities to the Stone too: the Resurrection Stone allows one to glimpse shades of the dead, as though through a veil. The One Ring shifts the wearer into an ‘unseen realm’ inhabited by wraiths… though by no means the same, both allow one to view into some sort of spiritual plane.

The Elder Wand is said to be more powerful than any other. Likewise, the One Ring has power over all the other rings.

Owning the three hallows makes you the ‘Master of Death’.  The One Ring extends the mortal bearers lifespan indefinitely- in a sense, is not the bearer also mastering death?

blog.name: racke7

tags: ''transfer student'' and ''exploring the new world'' is entirely reliant on which fandom ends up as the ''main pov''
as a SAO-character ending up in Hogwarts would be a new world to explore for that character
and an HP-character ending up in SAO would likely cause a lot of SAO-characters to look twice and scratch their heads
the other three are of course also reliant on which fandom is the ''main pov'' but those two in particular are very much mirrors
summary: The different forms of a crossover
title: The different forms of a crossover
body:
See, by now most everyone knows what a crossover is. Usually, they’ll also know about fusion-crossovers, but I feel like there’s a degree of misunderstanding surrounding these terms.

A crossover is a story that takes place with two (or more) fandoms involved. Whether that means using the characters or the setting and then playing them off of each other.

A fusion-crossover is a story that very specifically takes place in one universe. See, a crossover in general can include things like “Naruto touched a crystal and now he’s at Hogwarts”, where Hogwarts can indeed exist in an entirely separate universe from Naruto’s own. A fusion-crossover is instead something like “Lily Evans was an Uzumaki, and Naruto goes to visit his lost relative”, where the fact that both Naruto and Harry Potter belong to the same universe is a big part of the story.

That said, with fusion-crossovers I feel like there’s a few different themes in how they function.

The worlds of Harry Potter and Sword Art Online are probably good examples of how these different writing-angles can work out.

“Transfer student” – A few muggleborn SAO-survivors end up at Hogwarts in the aftermath of the SAO-incident. A way to explore how differently the traumas of SAO causes the new muggleborns to act, and how Hogwarts as a whole is changed by their presence.

“Exploring the new world” – Harry or Hermione or someone else takes a well-deserved break during one of the summer-breaks of Hogwarts and ends up logging in to SAO only for Kayaba to screw everyone over. A way to explore the world inside of SAO, and how Hogwarts-minded people are expected to deal with this, as well as potentially figure out how the grand mess that is Wizarding Britain ticks along in their absence.

“Re-imagining the old world” – Kayaba creates the fantastic new game “Hogwarts Online”, and then traps everyone inside of it until they’ve all cleared seven years worth of classes. A way of placing the SAO-characters into the familiar setting of Harry Potter, with death hanging over their heads, and allowing them to explore how beautiful and daunting Hogwarts can be when it’s become a prison.

“We needed OCs” – Magic doesn’t exist and Hogwarts is a normal boarding school, where the students somehow manage to get their hands on a NerveGear and boot up SAO. A bit similar to number two, however we’re forcing “normalcy” onto Hogwarts to fit in with the SAO-world which means that the characters of Harry Potter will act differently to a lot of the details, by for example not expecting magic to work. This kind of thing can also be the “extensive background story” of a random character that a protagonist runs into, an OC with thematically familiar name and appearance and personality and skill, but who belongs entirely to the other fandom’s world.

“This is our birthright” – In a world without magic, Kayaba creates the new game “Hogwarts Online” and the Harry Potter characters somehow all end up getting caught in it. A way of exploring the very different nuances of the old and previously well-known relationships between the different characters, along with their obviously different attitudes towards Hogwarts.

And that’s the five basic options that I can think of.

There’s plenty of different shades of writing within those five big “genres” of fusion-crossovers, and a seemingly infinite amount of stories involved, as it focuses on different characters or relationships or the more nitty-gritty differences of the many settings, but yeah. That’s fusion-crossovers.

summary:
Hufflepuff: I have cookies!
Ravenclaw: I have coffee
Gryffindor: I have cake!
Slytherin: I have a knife...
Everyone but...
body:
Hufflepuff: I have cookies!
Ravenclaw: I have coffee
Gryffindor: I have cake!
Slytherin: I have a knife...
Everyone but Slytherin: NO

blog.name: estherlehnsherr
blog.title: Esther
blog.description:
MARVEL | LORD OF THE RINGS | GAME OF THRONES | SHERLOCK | HARRY POTTER | STAR WARS/TREK | SUPERNATURAL | 
SO MANY FANDOMS

summary: Hogwarts Houses
body:
Hogwarts Houses

*from time to time looks like can kill you but actually a cinnamon roll* Gryffindor

*looks like a cinnamon roll but who knows* Ravenclaw

*looks like a cinnamon roll and actually a cinnamon roll (maybe)* Hufflepuff

*looks like can kill you and actually can kill you but deep inside is a cinnamon roll* Slytherin

blog.name: wlwolvemir
blog.title: Your friendly Neighbourhood Lesbian
blog.description: Proud encourager of critical thought/ You should read comics they’re good!!/ brown /Wolverhampton, England/ North America/ lesbian/ NO TERFS/Insta and Twitter @wlwolvemir /DA @Wolvemir/ see a post by someone who excludes others? tell me and i'll delete it.

summary: There are plenty of dark scenes and ideas in Harry Potter, but the one of the darkest is where Harry sees Lockhart in St....
caption: There are plenty of dark scenes and ideas in Harry Potter, but the one of the darkest is where Harry sees Lockhart in St. Mungo’s and finds out what happened to him after he lost his memories. That he may never get them back and has to stay there. He still receives fan mail although he doesn’t know why.

reblog.comment: There are plenty of dark scenes and ideas in Harry Potter, but the one of the darkest is where Harry sees Lockhart in St. Mungo’s and finds out what happened to him after he lost his memories. That he may never get them back and has to stay there. He still receives fan mail although he doesn’t know why.

That he may never get them back and has to stay there. He still receives fan mail although he doesn’t know why.
